data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word يَعْلَمُونَ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: (a doubly imperfect verb) To live, be alive, be ashamed, spend (the night) awake, fertilize the earth, keep anyone alive; spare any one, let anyone alive, remove prudency, modesty and shamefulness, make immodest
data.sentence: The word الْحَيَوةِ comes from the root ح ي ي and is associated with the meanings: (a doubly imperfect verb) To live, be alive, be ashamed, spend (the night) awake, fertilize the earth, keep anyone alive; spare any one, let anyone alive, remove prudency, modesty and shamefulness, make immodest

data.meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.
data.sentence: The word الدُّنْيَا comes from the root د ن و and is associated with the meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.

data.meanings: unmindful, forgetful, neglectful, heedless, intentionally neglecting or leaving or turning away
data.sentence: The word غَافِلُونَ comes from the root غ ف ل and is associated with the meanings: unmindful, forgetful, neglectful, heedless, intentionally neglecting or leaving or turning away

data.meanings: to appear, become distinct/clear/open/manifest, come out, ascend/mount, get the better of, know, distinguish, be obvious, go forth, enter the noon, neglect, have the upper hand over wound on the back. zahara - to help, back, support in the sense of collaboration. zihar - was a practice of the pre-Islamic days of the Arabs by which the wife was kept in suspense, sometimes for the whole of her life having neither the position of a wife nor that of a divorced woman free to marry elsewhere. The word zihar is derived from zahr meaning back.
data.sentence: The word ظَاهِرًا comes from the root ظ ه ر and is associated with the meanings: to appear, become distinct/clear/open/manifest, come out, ascend/mount, get the better of, know, distinguish, be obvious, go forth, enter the noon, neglect, have the upper hand over wound on the back. zahara - to help, back, support in the sense of collaboration. zihar - was a practice of the pre-Islamic days of the Arabs by which the wife was kept in suspense, sometimes for the whole of her life having neither the position of a wife nor that of a divorced woman free to marry elsewhere. The word zihar is derived from zahr meaning back.
